alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:39AM EDT until May 03 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Parking lots along Front Street begin to flood. Town dock begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water enters the back side of buildings along Water Street. Front Street becomes completely submerged. The parking lot by town dock flood. At 18.0 feet, Water enters Water St (Route 27/ Route 201). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:20 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 16.9 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 9.6 feet late Wednesday morning. It will rise to 10.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall to 9.0 feet late Wednesday evening. It will rise to 9.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
